text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pork diablo this recipe is a
little nostalgic for me this is the
first meat recipe I ever remember making
in culinary school so let me show you
how to put this together it is so simple
and very delicious now I'm just doing
one you can double this you can feed
about I don't know two to three people
out of one tenderloin and the good thing
is nowadays pork tenderloin comes pretty
much fully trimmed if you see any that
tough silver skin you want to peel that
off right some of that white fat see
that that's that silver skin that's just
fact that stuff will melt in the pan
we're going to season it generously with
black pepper and salt of course you got
a salt trim you thoroughly there's just
no other way around it alright I'm going
to put my heavy stainless steel pan on
high heat with some vegetable oil I want
to use a pan I can put right in the oven
alright so once that oil starts to
shimmer and we know it's very hot we're
going to place the pork in and we're
going to let it sear really well on just
one side because what I'm going to do is
turn this over and we're going to put it
in the oven and the other side will sear
while it roasts and this is a really
important step not only is it going to
give a great color and add flavor to the
actual meat itself it's going to help
start developing that Fond that
caramelization on the bottom of the pan
which is where our awesome sauce is
going to come from that's going to go in
a 375 degree oven for about about 20
minutes you want an internal temperature
of about 140 that's going to go up a
little bit as it rests alright the pork
is going to come out of the pan to rest
I'm going to get rid of some of that
excess fat which you know not a bad idea
so as soon as you wipe out that excess
oil we're going to quickly dump in our
chicken broth I'm going to turn the heat
to high and I'm going to bring that to a
boil as it comes to a boil all that fond
all that caramelized meat juice is going
to melt into the stock okay so the name
Diablo comes from the word devil which
means in old-school culinary terminology
something that has a little spice to it
a little burn like the fires of hell
while that's boiling I'm going to add
some cayenne some extra hot horseradish
and some Dijon mustard and then we're
going to also add a small splash of
cream which is going to do amazing
things in the whole process to make this
sauce is going to be about five minutes
which is how long you're resting your
meat see how that worked out stir that
in
again this is on high heat the whole way
boiling away all right I'm gonna switch
to whisk because I don't know why I'm

it reduces to that point all right see

throw in a chunk of cold butter you see

silky rich yet light and really

rested at least five minutes you can
